channel.title: Justa little help (Please) :)
channel.description: Can some one make a TUT or learn me?

item.title: Justa little help (Please) :)
item.dc:creator: @LittleMaffia LittleMaffia
item.description:
@LittleMaffia wrote:

I added this in my client.java

//Create Object. public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){ if(p != null){ client person = (client)p; if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")){ if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){ person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType); } } } } } public void NewObjects() { // Put Objects Here makeGlobalObject(3254, 3431, 2513, -1, 10);//Target

Now I get 1 error thats this one:

client.java:33: illegal start of expression
public static boolean LoggingClicks = false;
^
1 error
Files compiled successfully![br][size=1]Posted on: July 20, 2007, 03:43:48 AM[/size][hr]Ok fixed that 1 error , Now when I log in I cant see the Object where I spawned it can some one help?[br][size=1]Posted on: July 20, 2007, 03:45:18 AM[/size][hr]bump?

in client.java

item.title: Justa little help (Please) :)
item.dc:creator: @Called_enzo Called enzo
item.description:
@Called_enzo wrote:

thats easy lol

Declare this void

public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects
		for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
			if(p != null){
				client person = (client)p;
			if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")){
				if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
					person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);
				}
			}
		}
	}
	}

under that add this

public void NewObjects() {
// Put Objects Here
              makeGlobalObject(x coord, y coord, Id, direction, 10(dont change this));//Name of Object

then it should work

}

Read full topic
